contentrichtext.text: {{taxobox |image = Quercusduratadurata.jpg |image_caption = var. ''durata'' |regnum = [[Plant]]ae |unranked_divisio = [[Angiosperms]] |unranked_classis = [[Eudicots]] |unranked_ordo = [[Rosids]] |ordo = [[Fagales]] |familia = [[Fagaceae]] |genus = ''[[Oak|Quercus]]'' |species = '''''Q. durata''''' |binomial = ''Quercus durata'' |binomial_authority = [[Willis Linn Jepson|Jeps.]] |}} '''''Quercus durata''''' ('''California Scrub Oak''', '''Leather Oak'''; [[syn.]] ''Quercus dumosa revoluta'' Sarg.) is an [[oak]] [[Endemism|endemic]] to [[California]]. ''Quercus durata'' var. ''durata'' is a strict serpentine endemic that occurs in the Coast Range and northern Sierra Nevadas. It is often a component of serpentine chaparral. Most individuals are short (< {{convert|5|m|ft}}) and have small, densely organized leaves. ==Cultivation== This plant is often used as an urban tree and medicinal plant.{{cn|date=November 2011}} ==See also== *[[California chaparral and woodlands]] - (''ecoregion'') ==References== *C. Michael Hogan. 2010. [http://www.eoearth.org/article/Leather_Oak ''Leather Oak, Quercus durata''. Encyclopedia of Earth. National Council for Science and Environment]. Washington DC ==External links== *[http://ucjeps.berkeley.edu/cgi-bin/get_JM_treatment.pl?4316,4326,4337 Jepson Manual Treatment - ''Quercus durata''] *[http://www.pfaf.org/database/plants.php?Quercus+durata Plants For A Future: ''Quercus durata''] *[http://plants.usda.gov/java/profile?symbol=QUDU4 USDA Plants Profile: ''Quercus durata''] *[http://www.efloras.org/florataxon.aspx?flora_id=1&taxon_id=233501024 Flora of North America: ''Quercus durata''] *[http://calphotos.berkeley.edu/cgi/img_query?query_src=photos_index&where-taxon=Quercus+durata ''Quercus durata'' - Photo gallery] [[Category:Quercus|durata]] [[Category:Endemic flora of California]] [[Category:Trees of California]] [[Category:Flora of the Sierra Nevada (U.S.)]] [[Category:Flora of California chaparral and woodlands]] [[Category:Flora of the California desert regions]] [[Category:Medicinal plants]] [[Category:Trees of Mediterranean climate]] [[Category:Garden plants of North America]] [[Category:Drought-tolerant trees]] [[Category:Ornamental trees]] {{tree-stub}}
